description: This file provides utility functions and a class for handling JSON serialization and conversion of string inputs to appropriate Python data types. It includes methods for parsing strings into booleans, numbers, or nulls, and a JSON class that supports adding key-value pairs, serializing to a formatted JSON string, and encapsulating JSON data. It appears to be a helper module used within a larger project, likely for configuration or data manipulation tasks.

classes.name: JSON
classes.description: A class for managing JSON data with methods for adding elements, updating, serializing, and controlling attribute setting.

methods.name: convert_string(s)
methods.description: Converts a string to an int, float, boolean, or null if possible, otherwise returns the string.

methods.name: boolean(val)
methods.description: Converts string representations like 'on' or 'true' to boolean True; otherwise False.

methods.name: serialize(self, ind=2)
methods.description: Serializes the JSON object into a pretty-printed JSON string.

methods.name: __init__(self)
methods.description: Initializes a JSON object with an empty internal dictionary.

methods.name: add(self, key, val)
methods.description: Adds a key-value pair to the JSON object, converting the value if necessary.

methods.name: update(self, other)
methods.description: Updates the JSON object with data from another JSON instance.

methods.name: __bool__(self)
methods.description: Returns True if the internal dictionary is not empty, otherwise False.

methods.name: __setattr__(self, key, value)
methods.description: Overrides attribute setting to restrict direct assignment to private variables.
